title: [Onboarding] Have the ability to use fingerprint log in to the app (including Touch ID)
body:
### User Story

As a user it would be nice to use fingerprint log in to the app. In many environments (such as conferences) it feels awkward to enter passwords on the phone while people/cameras are potentially watching and that password unlocks access to digital assets.

---

To the bounty hunter:

(1) Add a setting to require touch/face-id to sign-in (just like "Browser privacy mode")
(2) Implement biometric protection to the saved password entry for iOS and for Android (you might use a 3rd party library for that).
(3) This should be disabled by default.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
I think this is still a good feature and other wallets offer it (such as imToken).
It is partially addressed by plainly storing your password. It doesn't protect if you give your smartphone to someone else though, for that it might be useful.

Issue Status: 1. **Open** 2. Started 3. Submitted 4. Done

Thank you for applying!
